one_reviews_text: Program won't open. I get to the opennimg screen then screen stay black.
review_feedback: Hi! Sorry to hear that you're having issues. Please email feedback@vtime.net so we can get more information and help.

one_reviews_text: Don't waste your time. Be aware you can't move, walk, etc. here. It's all very static, zero interaction. Worst chat ever.
review_feedback: Hello! Sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy the app. vTime XR is an app designed for good conversation, and we find most people have better conversations while seated. I will share your feedback with the team though.

one_reviews_text:
after the latest update had broken vtime hand tracking i fixed it buy completely deleating all files and doing a fresh install hand tracking now working.
i give 3 stars as the latest update that added video rooms was a total waist of time as no one can play any personal videos and you have nothing to watch except a handfull of total trash sport video clips.
review_feedback: Hi! Sorry to hear you're having trouble and this is defnitely a bug that we'd like to look into as we've had no other reports of this. Could you email feedback@vtime.net so that we can get some details?

one_reviews_text: This has to be the third or fourth time I've updated this review. I had an isolated issue with one of the destinations failing to load recently, so I submitted a ticket to tech support. Given that vTime is five years old, at this point, I wasn't really expecting much to come of it. I was pleasantly surprised to receive a reply with questions about the issue within a couple of hours, and tech support fixed the problem in a very timely fashion. There is a lot to love about vTime. It is still one of the most beautiful apps out there, managing to provide a variety of well-designed environments while only requiring a modest amount of storage space. It's a place where you can take a short vacation on one of two beaches, take in a sunset, pretend you're riding to Hogwarts on a train, fly in a Private Jet, sit on an ice block in Antarctica, drink your coffee in Paris, and experience so many other beautiful spaces and places. I can now add phenomenal tech support to the reasons I love this experience. Oh. You can chat on it too. ;)
review_feedback: Thanks for your review! We're really happy we could help.

one_reviews_text: Can only hold 6 accounts at a time, is there a way to delete them? Reinstalling doesn't work.
review_feedback: Hello! Sorry to hear you're having issues. It sounds like the app folder isn't being deleted when you uninstall. Navigate to C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\LocalLow\Starship Group and delete the folder before you reinstall. Email feedback@vtime.net if you need any help.

one_reviews_text: Can you guys create a heaven and hell experieince. Loving what you are doing.
review_feedback: Hey, daspeiker! Great suggestion. Thanks for sharing. I'll pass it on to the team. If you have any other suggestions, email feedback@vtime.net.

one_reviews_text: Any news on this being brought to the quest last time i heard it was being worked on how long will this take? Dont tell us its not possible, it works on the go and on the rift so why not the quest? It shouldnt be that difficult to port over or what not.
review_feedback: Hey Mr_Popsicles! We are still planning on coming to Quest, but we don't have a launch date to share. In the meantime, you can use vTime XR on your Quest through Oculus Link. Email us on feedback@vtime.net if you have any questions.

one_reviews_text: altspace is more fun
review_feedback: Hey coulterminer. Sorry to hear you didn't enjoy vTime. If you have any suggestions for how we could improve the app, email feedback@vtime.net and let us know.

review_title: It used to just work - not anymore!
one_reviews_text: In the beginning you chose a destination and auto teleported there. Now you have to download destination while wearing a headset.  Who was the genius who destroyed the user experience?
review_feedback: Hi Mzvgladstone! Thanks for sharing your feedback. We're sorry to hear you're not enjoying the experience. Once you've downloaded a destination, it's in your library to visit instantly (provided you didn't uncheck a box during download). Destinations can also be downloaded via the Library. Open the menu and go to your library, select 'Destinations', choose your destination, select 'download', and the destination will download in the background. I'll pass your feedback on to the team though.

one_reviews_text:
Subject says it all.  You guys don't need to know all my contacts.  I don't want you sending spam to my friends.  That is is pure crap.

Edit:  Dev responded below.  My rebuttal is, "Then why don't you say it's optional on the form?  It's presented as if there's no other option but to provide the asked-for information."
review_feedback: Hey DoubleShot. That permission is optional and we don't use it to get your contacts. We use it to get your email address so you don't have to type it in VR and we don't store it. Find out more about the permissions we ask for here: https://vtime.net/permissions EDIT: Android don't allow us to mark it as optional, but we can look at adding an extra screen in-app to give users more info on this.

one_reviews_text: I have updated my review from 5 stars to 2 stars for the following reasons: There appears to be little progress since 2 years ago. They have reduced the number of environments, including some of my favourites, so have actually made the app worse.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear that you're not enjoying the changes that we've made. The destinations  in vTime now change regularly, with new and seasonal destinations cycling in and out throughout the year, along with old favourites. We're also working on new features that we can share more on soon! I'll pass on your feedback to the team, and hope you'll enjoy what we have coming next.

one_reviews_text: Hey I'm using a TracFone it fits but can't connect the control or not working any ideas
review_feedback: Hey Dd! This version of vTime is for Oculus Rift and is compatible with Rift Touch controllers. We've not heard of using TracFone with the Rift. Could you email feedback@vtime.net so that we can get a bit more information?

one_reviews_text: I'm struggling to comprehend why on earth the decision was made to remove 70% of the content. I checked today and all my favourites destinations have gone. The Paris rooftop, the beach at sunset, the cave in the winter, all gone. They haven't even been replaced by anything. I understand wanting to add in more rooms but why remove the existing ones? My friend and I that are 300 miles apart used this to hang out and chat, looks like we need a new place, so disappointing and uncomprehendable!
review_feedback: Sorry to hear that you're unhappy with the recent changes. None of the destinations have gone for good. Instead, we’re trying something different. From now on, we’ll be mixing up the destinations that are on offer regularly, so you’ll see all of your favourites again as well as new and seasonal ones! We’ve just added in new seasonal destination Abandoned Hope.

one_reviews_text: When I tried Vtime for the first time I was floored and amazed at how simple it was to create an avatar and join a group and start making new friends. I enjoyed it so much I started bugging everyone I knew to get it on their phones and rifts! But then the update came...and they got rid of all the good rooms and everyones volumn was so high it was distorted. In my group of friends we had Canadians who loved the artic themed room, harry potter fans who LOVED the train car theme, and an avid outdoorsman who thought the starry night theme was the bomb. Now...when I go into Vtime there is barely anyone online, and all my friends are gone because who wants to sit in only a couple of rooms. Boring :( This was 5 stars but now I'm afraid its dropped to a 2. I don't think I will use it much anymore when the only people online seems to be the ones trying to learn english and dont talk back. If you build it they will come! Bring back those awesome rooms!!!
review_feedback: Hello! Sorry to hear that you're not happy with our recent changes. None of the destinations have gone for good as we'll be changing the destinations on offer regularly, as well as adding in new ones. With regards to the audio issues, we published a build this week that should solve your issues there. If you're still having trouble, email feedback@vtime.net so that we can look into it.

one_reviews_text: I started downloading a 105 mb scene file which should have taken seconds.  At 45% 20 min later I quit the client and removed it.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear that you experienced some issues over Christmas. Sounds like there may have been some server issues, though all appears to be working normally at our end at present. I'll forward your review to the team to investigate. Email feedback@vtime.net if you have any other questions.

one_reviews_text: Great experience, but it seems a no-brainer to add options to share photos/videos with individual members, or to display them in the destination for all to see.
review_feedback: Hello! You can already share images with your friends in vTime destinations such as The Boardroom and 360 Gallery. Learn how to share images in vTime here: https://vtime.net/news/2017/how-to-share-images-in-vtime

one_reviews_text:
If I wanted to hang out alone I could do it without spending money to do so.
Tomorrow I'm going to a crab feed, now that's a shell I can enjoy.

review_title: Meet, chat and share in VR
one_reviews_text: Meet, chat and share in VR nul
review_feedback: Hello, sorry to hear you didn't enjoy vTime. If you need any help, email us on feedback@vtime.net.

one_reviews_text:
the software is amazing and really just had to exist, period. this is one of those killer apps you keep installed to show how versatile and cool VR can be from a social aspect - nothing else comes close. HOWEVER...

all locations should download by default, and let people delete the ones they dont like. instead of making people wait in the headset for each one to download the first time. thanks!
Cannot get past the avatar creation.   It insists I"m a woman.   Third try.  I might be done here.
You can only use the virtual keyboard, and it's not worth speding 30 minutes trying to enter an email address. I have a keyboard connected to my computer, let me use it.
review_feedback: Hello, Rift users have always been able to use the keyboard to enter their email address during set-up. Email feedback@vtime.net if you're still having issues.

one_reviews_text: It seems well made in terms of visual polish but just has a very unwelcoming interface.  You have to select options and even type by looking at and lingering over buttons while your perfectly useful hands just sit there unused.  It takes forever just to get an avatar set up and by the time you're done, your neck is too sore from all the robotic motions you had to make just to work the interface.  Uninstalled.

review_title: Cannot start game. Stuck in lobby
one_reviews_text: All I can see it the first hall with nothing but a blank bubble that won't let me press it.  No help from support. Apparently it's a good experience, but for me it has been the most frustrating one I have encountered so far.
fun to interact an nice people
awful

vtime reminds me of imvu the flat panel social application thats been around for years, Simple and easy to use built with small group dialog in mind. Could use some more conversation sparking interactive elements (minigames collaboration), your experiance is going to be highly defined by who you end up interacting with as with any chat program.. Had some great discussions on here.

Pros+
-Cross platform (a must for social vr experiances)
-Small filespace footprint (enviroments are like 100mb a piece)
-audio and the voice chat seem to work flawless
-graphics are a+ considering it works on smartphone face devices                                                                                    

Cons-
-No touch menu interaciton for rift (headtracking and button press ui)(arm tracking does work)
-No personal rooms or room customization
-Very limited customization in the clothes department
-small userbase (but existant and active)
-no enviroment interaction 
-4 person room occupancy is abit limiting (suggestion 2-12 host defined by host)
i came froma altspace but it closed down so can you not close it thanks.
SO MUCH FUN I LOVE IT

Devs, if your listenning, this app is exactly what is going to kill VR. How can you put out publicly something so broken?! Everything from signing up to moving to typing is broken. What were you guys thinking?
review_feedback: Hey Killmore101, sorry to hear you're having trouble. Could you email feedback@vtime.net so that we can explore what's happening at your end? We've had no other users reporting similar issues.

review_title: One of the TOP social VR experiences
one_reviews_text: Best social VR spot for having a legit conversations, and meeting new and unique people from around the world!
review_feedback: Thanks, ChunkyToads! Glad you're enjoying it!

one_reviews_text: I have only used this a handful of times. Great avatar customization options. Environments are absolutely amazing--- I mean the best by far out of all of them, Bigscreen, Virtual Desktop, VRChat, AltSpaces, etc. My only issue is talking to strangers is often hit or miss with the same people often lurking. Maybe I am boring too, but many just don't talk while I am trying to keep/get a coversation going. Maybe a conversation topics prompt as a feature? This will be great to converse with friends far away or close.

i couldint get it started cause i got my email wrong whatever you do if youre entering youre eamil and say its right when its not it might not let you try again i entered my email and i screwed up  i coulding play the game i dont want to give it a bad review saence ididint know how to start it so 3 for 3
review_feedback: Hello! Sorry to hear you entered your email incorrectly, but the good news is it's easily solvable. Head back into vTime, and you'll be presented with two options 'Check Again' and 'Resend Email'. Choose 'Resend Email', and you'll be given the option of entering your email again. If you have any more issues, email feedback@vtime.net.

review_title: Most People Don't Relate too me
one_reviews_text: everyone I meet are people who use GearVR and I don't know what to talk about with these people because they so called have "actual lifes" I can't talk to these people about new VR titles or anything! It has to be personal! But other than that it would've been a great platform for talking to people.

My 2nd review.  Most people are decent and friendly, NOT as some may suggest! If you don't like the people you are chatting with, just leave!  Anyway, back to the app.,  I would still like to see improvements to the avatar's, like more realistic hair maybe with hair textures, instead of just a block on top of your head.  Other textures on the avatar and clothes could be improved, and the colors are still too vivid.  Maybe you could increase the range of movement a little more, and be able to stand up. Support for Rift and Vive hand controllers, a big improvement.

I will admit, logging in for the first time and chatting with people in a VR environment was REALLY cool. But with other programs having more to do, its really hard to stick around.  Some must have features are 1. Region filtering 2. Video Sharing 3. YouTube support (full web browsing would be better)
i tried this app and most of the time it had people asking how old i was and where i lived
review_feedback: Hi NovaKane12, we work hard to ensure that vTime is a pleasant and safe place to be by listening to the community and acting when a user is causing problems. All of the community are able to block and report other users quickly and easily. We take all reports seriously, so please let us know if you've seen any behaviour that goes against our community guidelines.

one_reviews_text: Without more features, this app really feels just like an online chat room, but in VR and with voice. There are 19 environments to chat in, but not much to actually do other than simply talk. It has potential, but feels like a gimmick when compared with simple video conferencing which is better for most situations for people you know or compared to AltSpace for meeting and hanging out with new people while bonding over activities.
but its not like other vr spaces where u can move about like vr chat,altspace,rec room,High feditly etc if you could move that would be brillaint aswel as having shows etc
The environments are great but since I voted for Trump, nobody wants to talk to me here. :(
Very good, add more destination! More people, type Spain, Brasil and Portuguese! :)
meet my friend that moved and cryed tires of joy:D

Avatar is better as well as surroundings, But has not pulled me away from Alt Space yet, there is no touch controller support nor any interactions as far as games, just sit at a table and chat is all this is. combine Alt Space with this one and you have something.

This is an amazing app, its in the same genra  with altsspace and recroom for social exp. although with the lack of touch controllers I can only give this app a 4/5. The competitor apps have games and flawless touch support, I loved this app before I got my touch now unfortunaly I will have to use the others until touch is available.

Great concept, VRtime makes hanging out in virtual reality a lot less lonely. If only there were more things to do, such as games, this would be a killer app. The dev's are truly onto something special here though.

There is indeed not much to do but that is not necessarily a bad thing. People don't get lost in silly games or movies. The focus is set completely on each other and will result in some fun encounters with interesting people

It's a great concept, but without interaction there is nothing to do.
I can use Skype If I want to talk to someone.
